spiceweasel.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /************************************************************************
00002  * Multi-threaded code to process video frames, producing a composite
00003  * output frame. Use three threads:
00004  * - Input thread: reads in frames for processing
00005  * - Processing thread: Computes background frame(s), processes frame
00006  *                      and produces output frame data
00007  * - Output thread: Writes out frame to file
00008  *
00009  * MIT LICENSE:
00010  *
00011  * Copyright (c) 2006 B.Dudson, UKAEA Fusion and Oxford University
00012  *
00013  * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining
00014  * a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"),
00015  * to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation
00016  * the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense,
00017  * and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software
00018  * is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
00019  *
00020  * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
00021  * copies or substantial portions of the Software.
00022  *
00023  * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
00024  * INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A
00025  * PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT
00026  * HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION
00027  * OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE
00028  * SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
00029  *
00030  * Changelog: 
00031  *
00032  * October 2006: Initial release by Ben Dudson, UKAEA Fusion/Oxford University
00033  ************************************************************************/

00048 /* thread syncronization */
00049 pthread_mutex_t input_ready_mutex, process_ready_mutex, output_ready_mutex;
00050 pthread_cond_t input_ready_cond, process_ready_cond, output_ready_cond;
00051 int input_ready, process_ready, output_ready;
00052 
00053 /* Input data */
00054 TFrame *input_frame[2];
00055 int frame_read;  /* Frame number last read */
00056 
00057 /* Output data */
00058 TFrame *output_frame[2];
00059 int frame_written; /* Frame number last written */
00060 
00061 int startframe, endframe; /* Frame numbers to process */

00064 /************** ACTUAL PROCESSING ROUTINES ***************/
00065 
00066 int check_format(char *template) /* Check file extension of template */
00067 {
00068   int n;
00069   int format;
00070 
00071   n = strlen(template);
00072   if(n < 4) {
00073     return(FORMAT_UNKNOWN);
00074   }
00075   if(strncasecmp(&(template[n-4]), ".bmp", 4) == 0) {
00076     /* bitmap format */
00077     format = FORMAT_BMP;
00078   }else if(strncasecmp(&(template[n-4]), ".png", 4) == 0) {
00079     format = FORMAT_PNG;
00080   }else if(strncasecmp(&(template[n-4]), ".ipx", 4) == 0) {
00081     format = FORMAT_IPX;
00082   }else {
00083     format = FORMAT_UNKNOWN;
00084   }
00085 
00086   return(format);
00087 }
00088 
00089 void read_colormap()
00090 {
00091     
00092   /*
00093   // Simple temperature scale
00094   colormap.n = 5;
00095   colormap.value = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*5);
00096   colormap.red   = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*5);
00097   colormap.green = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*5);
00098   colormap.blue  = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*5);
00099 
00100   colormap.value[0] = 0.00; colormap.red[0] =   0.0; colormap.green[0] =   0.0; colormap.blue[0] =   0.0;
00101   colormap.value[1] = 0.25; colormap.red[1] = 255.0; colormap.green[1] =   0.0; colormap.blue[1] =   0.0;
00102   colormap.value[2] = 0.50; colormap.red[2] =   0.0; colormap.green[2] = 255.0; colormap.blue[2] =   0.0;
00103   colormap.value[3] = 0.75; colormap.red[3] =   0.0; colormap.green[3] =   0.0; colormap.blue[3] = 255.0;
00104   colormap.value[4] = 1.00; colormap.red[4] = 255.0; colormap.green[4] = 255.0; colormap.blue[4] = 255.0;
00105   
00106   */
00107   
00108   // Yellowy temperature scale
00109 
00110   colormap.n = 4;
00111   colormap.value = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*4);
00112   colormap.red   = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*4);
00113   colormap.green = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*4);
00114   colormap.blue  = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*4);
00115   
00116   colormap.value[0] = 0.00; colormap.red[0] =   0.0; colormap.green[0] =   0.0; colormap.blue[0] =   0.0;
00117   colormap.value[1] = 0.33; colormap.red[1] = 255.0; colormap.green[1] =   0.0; colormap.blue[1] =   0.0;
00118   colormap.value[2] = 0.67; colormap.red[2] = 255.0; colormap.green[2] = 255.0; colormap.blue[2] =   0.0;
00119   colormap.value[3] = 1.00; colormap.red[3] = 255.0; colormap.green[3] = 255.0; colormap.blue[3] = 255.0;
00120 }
00121 
00122 TRawFrame writeraw;
00123 IPX_status ipx_write_status;
00124 
00125 void write_init()
00126 {
00127   int depth;
00128   writeraw.allocated = 0;
00129 
00130   if(output_format == FORMAT_IPX) {
00131     
00132     depth = 16;
00133     /* Setup output header */
00134     if(input_format == FORMAT_IPX) {
00135       depth = ipx_read_status.header.depth;
00136       
00137       /* Copy header from input */
00138       memcpy(&(ipx_write_status.header), &(ipx_read_status.header), sizeof(IPX_header));
00139     }else {
00140       /* Clear header */
00141       memset(&(ipx_write_status.header), 0, sizeof(IPX_header));
00142     }
00143 
00144     /* Open output file */
00145     printf("Opening IPX output file %s...", output_template);
00146     if(IPX_write_open(output_template, depth, &ipx_write_status)) {
00147       printf("failed!\n");
00148       exit(1);
00149     }
00150     printf("done\n");
00151     
00152   }
00153 
00154   read_colormap();
00155 }
00156 
00157 void write_finish()
00158 {
00159   if(output_format == FORMAT_IPX) {
00160     IPX_write_close(&ipx_write_status);
00161   }
00162 }
00163 
00164 int write_frame(TFrame *frame)
00165 {
00166   char filename[MAX_NAME_LEN];
00167   int errcode;
00168   int rowbytes;
00169   int i, j, k, p, n;
00170   float val, v1, v2, vd;
00171 
00172   if(output_format == FORMAT_IPX) {
00173     /* Write frames to an IPX file */
00174     if(IPX_write_frame(frame, &ipx_write_status)) {
00175       printf("Error writing frame\n");
00176       exit(1);
00177     }
00178   }else {
00179     /* Write a series of files, one per frame */
00180     //printf("***Writing output frame %d\n", frame->number);
00181     sprintf(filename, output_template, frame->number);
00182 
00183     rowbytes = frame->width * OUTPUT_BYTEDEPTH;
00184     if(OUTPUT_COLOR) 
00185       rowbytes *= 3; /* 3 channel */
00186 
00187     if(writeraw.allocated) {
00188       /* Data already allocated - check same size */
00189       if((writeraw.width != frame->width) || 
00190          (writeraw.height != frame->height) ||
00191          (writeraw.rowbytes != rowbytes)) {
00192         return(IO_ERROR_SIZE);
00193       }  
00194     }else {
00195       /* Allocate memory */
00196       
00197       writeraw.bpp = 8*OUTPUT_BYTEDEPTH;
00198       writeraw.channels = 1;
00199       if(OUTPUT_COLOR)
00200         writeraw.channels = 3;
00201       writeraw.rowbytes = rowbytes;
00202       
00203       writeraw.data = (unsigned char**) malloc(sizeof(unsigned char*)*frame->height);
00204       for(i=0;i!=frame->height;i++)
00205         writeraw.data[i] = (unsigned char*) malloc(rowbytes*sizeof(unsigned char));
00206       writeraw.width = frame->width;
00207       writeraw.height = frame->height;
00208       writeraw.allocated =  1;
00209     }
00210 
00211     /* Convert frame to output format */
00212     if(OUTPUT_COLOR) {
00213       /* Output 3-channel color */
00214       n = colormap.n - 1;
00215       for(i=0;i<frame->width;i++) {
00216         for(j=0;j<frame->height;j++) {
00217           val = frame->data[i][j];
00218           if(val <= colormap.value[0]) {
00219             writeraw.data[j][3*i] = colormap.red[0];
00220             writeraw.data[j][3*i + 1] = colormap.green[0];
00221             writeraw.data[j][3*i + 2] = colormap.blue[0];
00222           }else if(val >= colormap.value[n]) {
00223             writeraw.data[j][3*i] = colormap.red[n];
00224             writeraw.data[j][3*i + 1] = colormap.green[n];
00225             writeraw.data[j][3*i + 2] = colormap.blue[n];
00226           }else {
00227             /* Interpolate */
00228             p = 1;
00229             for(k=1;k<=n;k++) {
00230               if(colormap.value[k] >= val) {
00231                 p = k;
00232                 k = n+1; /* break loop */
00233               }
00234             }
00235             /* p is now the first index greater than current value */
00236             vd = colormap.value[p] - colormap.value[p-1];
00237             v1 = (val - colormap.value[p-1]) / vd;
00238             v2 = (colormap.value[p] - val) / vd;
00239             
00240             //printf("%d, %d -> %d, %f, %f\n", j, i, p, v1, v2);
00241             
00242             /* red channel */
00243             writeraw.data[j][3*i] = (unsigned char) (0.5 + colormap.red[p]*v1 + colormap.red[p-1]*v2);
00244             /* green channel */
00245             writeraw.data[j][3*i+1] = (unsigned char) (0.5 + colormap.green[p]*v1 + colormap.green[p-1]*v2);
00246             /* blue channel */
00247             writeraw.data[j][3*i+2] = (unsigned char) (0.5 + colormap.blue[p]*v1 + colormap.blue[p-1]*v2);
00248           }
00249         }
00250       }
00251     }else {
00252       /* Greyscale */
00253       if(writeraw.bpp > 16) {
00254         printf("\nSorry: Cannot write greyscale images > 16bpp\n");
00255         exit(1);
00256       }else if(writeraw.bpp > 8) {
00257         /* Put into 2 bytes per pixel */
00258         printf("\nSorry: Cannor write greyscale images > 8bpp yet\n");
00259         exit(1);
00260       }else {
00261         /* One byte per pixel */
00262         for(i=0;i<frame->width;i++) {
00263           for(j=0;j<frame->height;j++) {
00264             if(frame->data[i][j] > 1.0)
00265               frame->data[i][j] = 1.0;
00266             if(frame->data[i][j] < 0.0)
00267               frame->data[i][j] = 0.0;
00268             writeraw.data[j][i] = (unsigned char) (0.5 + frame->data[i][j] * 255.0);
00269           }
00270         }
00271       }
00272     }
00273     
00274     /* Write the data in a format */
00275     
00276     errcode = 0;
00277     switch(output_format) {
00278     case FORMAT_BMP: {
00279       //errcode =  write_bmp(filename, frame);
00280       break;
00281     }
00282     case FORMAT_PNG: {
00283       errcode =  write_png(filename, &writeraw);
00284       break;
00285     }
00286     default: {
00287       errcode = IO_ERROR_FORMAT;
00288     }
00289     }
00290     
00291     if(errcode) {
00292       switch(errcode) {
00293       case IO_ERROR_OPEN: {
00294         printf("Error: Could not open output file %s\n", filename);
00295         break;
00296       }
00297       case IO_ERROR_FORMAT: {
00298         printf("Error: Output file %s has an invalid file format\n", filename);
00299         break;
00300       }
00301       case IO_ERROR_WRITE: {
00302         printf("Error: Write error on file %s\n", filename);
00303         break;
00304       }
00305       case IO_ERROR_OTHER: {
00306       printf("Error: Could not write output file %s\n", filename);
00307       break;
00308       }
00309       }
00310       exit(1);
00311     }
00312   }
00313 
00314   return(0);
00315 }
00316 
00317 /************* MULTI-THREADED SYNCRONIZATION CODE ***********/
00318 
00319 /* This routine reads in a set of inputs, keeps reading when needed */
00320 void* input_routine(void *args)
00321 {
00322   int frame;
00323   int cycle;
00324   int finished;
00325 
00326   cycle = 1; /* Opposite to processing thread */
00327   frame = startframe; /* Frame number to read */
00328   finished = 0;
00329 
00330   do {
00331     /* Tell main thread input is ready */
00332     pthread_mutex_lock(&input_ready_mutex);
00333     input_ready = cycle;
00334     pthread_cond_signal(&input_ready_cond);
00335     pthread_mutex_unlock(&input_ready_mutex);
00336 
00337     /* Wait for main thread */
00338     pthread_mutex_lock(&process_ready_mutex);
00339     while(process_ready == cycle) {
00340       pthread_cond_wait(&process_ready_cond, &process_ready_mutex);
00341     }
00342     pthread_mutex_unlock(&process_ready_mutex);
00343 
00344     /* Read in data to input_frame[cycle] */
00345     read_frame(frame, input_frame[cycle]);
00346 
00347     frame_read = frame;
00348     
00349     /* Read routine may already have set this as last frame.
00350        If this is the last requested frame, mark and finish */
00351     //input_frame[cycle]->last = 0;
00352     if(frame == endframe)
00353       input_frame[cycle]->last = 1;
00354     if(input_frame[cycle]->last == 1)
00355       finished = 1;
00356 
00357     cycle ^= 1; /* Flip between frames */
00358     frame++;
00359   }while(!finished);
00360   //printf("Input terminating\n");
00361   
00362   /* Tell main thread input is ready */
00363   pthread_mutex_lock(&input_ready_mutex);
00364   input_ready = cycle;
00365   pthread_cond_signal(&input_ready_cond);
00366   pthread_mutex_unlock(&input_ready_mutex);
00367 
00368   fflush(stdout);
00369   pthread_exit(NULL);
00370 }
00371 
00372 /* Outputs finished frames */
00373 void* output_routine(void *args)
00374 {
00375   int finished;
00376   int cycle;
00377 
00378   cycle = 1; /* Opposite to processing thread */
00379   finished = 0;
00380 
00381   do {
00382     /* Tell main thread output ready */
00383     pthread_mutex_lock(&output_ready_mutex);
00384     output_ready = cycle;
00385     pthread_cond_signal(&output_ready_cond);
00386     pthread_mutex_unlock(&output_ready_mutex);
00387 
00388     /* Wait for main thread */
00389     pthread_mutex_lock(&process_ready_mutex);
00390     while(process_ready == cycle) {
00391       pthread_cond_wait(&process_ready_cond, &process_ready_mutex);
00392     }
00393     pthread_mutex_unlock(&process_ready_mutex);
00394 
00395     if(output_frame[cycle]->allocated) { /* If valid data present */
00396       /* Output data in output_frame[cycle] */
00397       write_frame(output_frame[cycle]);
00398 
00399       /* Check if this is the last frame */
00400       if(output_frame[cycle]->last) {
00401         //printf("Output reached last frame\n");
00402         finished = 1;  
00403       }
00404 
00405       frame_written = output_frame[cycle]->number; 
00406     }
00407 
00408     cycle ^= 1; /* Flip between frames */
00409   }while(!finished);
00410 
00411   pthread_exit(NULL);
00412 }
00413 
00414 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00415 {
00416   /* Thread handles */
00417   pthread_t input_thread, output_thread;
00418   void *retval;
00419 
00420   int nframes; /* Size of framebuffer */
00421   int framereplace, centreframe;
00422   TFrame **framebuffer; /* Buffer of frames */
00423   TFrame *tmpframe;
00424   
00425   int cycle;  /* Keeps track of which buffer to use */
00426   int finished, status;
00427   int i, n;
00428 
00429   char *script;
00430 
00431   /* Status information */
00432   int last_read, last_written;
00433   float progress, total;
00434   time_t start_time, end_time;
00435 
00436   /* Start timing */
00437   start_time = time(NULL);
00438   
00439   strncpy(input_template, DEFAULT_INPUT_NAME, MAX_NAME_LEN-1);
00440   input_template[MAX_NAME_LEN-1] = 0;
00441   strncpy(output_template, DEFAULT_OUTPUT_NAME, MAX_NAME_LEN-1);
00442   output_template[MAX_NAME_LEN-1] = 0;
00443   
00444   /******** CHECK COMMAND-LINE ARGUMENTS ********/
00445 
00446   if(argc < 4) {
00447     printf("Useage: %s <start frame> <final frame> <buffer size> [options]\n", argv[0]);
00448     printf("  Options:\n");
00449     printf("    -s <shot number>     Set input shot number\n");
00450     printf("    -i <input template>  Set input file template\n");
00451     printf("    -o <output template> Set output file template\n");
00452     printf("    -p <SPS file>        Set processing script\n");
00453     printf("  See README.txt for more details\n\n");
00454     return(1);
00455   }
00456   if(sscanf(argv[1], "%d", &startframe) != 1) {
00457     printf("Useage: First argument must be starting frame number\n");
00458     return(1);
00459   }
00460   if(sscanf(argv[2], "%d", &endframe) != 1) {
00461     printf("Useage: Second argument must be final frame number\n");
00462     return(1);
00463   }
00464   if(sscanf(argv[3], "%d", &nframes) != 1) {
00465     printf("Useage: Third argument must be size of the frame buffer\n");
00466     return(1);
00467   }
00468 
00469   if((nframes & 1) == 0) {
00470     nframes++;
00471     printf("---Frame buffer size must be odd: changing to %d\n", nframes);
00472   }
00473 
00474   if(startframe + nframes > (endframe+1)) {
00475     printf("***Not enough frames to fill buffer\n");
00476     return(1);
00477   }
00478 
00479   /* Go through options */
00480 
00481   script = (char*) NULL;
00482 
00483   for(i=4; i<argc;i++) {
00484     if(strncasecmp(argv[i], "-i", 2) == 0) {
00485       /* Set input name */
00486       i++;
00487       if(i == argc) {
00488         printf("Option useage is -i <input template>\n");
00489         return(1);
00490       }
00491       strncpy(input_template, argv[i], MAX_NAME_LEN-1);
00492       input_template[MAX_NAME_LEN-1] = 0;
00493       
00494     }else if(strncasecmp(argv[i], "-s", 2) == 0) {
00495       /* Set a shot number */
00496       i++;
00497       if(i == argc) {
00498         printf("Option useage is -s <shot number>\n");
00499         return(1);
00500       }
00501       if(sscanf(argv[i], "%d", &n) != 1) {
00502         printf("Shot number (-s option) must be an integer\n");
00503         return(1);
00504       }
00505       sprintf(input_template, SHOT_NAME, n);
00506     }else if(strncasecmp(argv[i], "-o", 2) == 0) {
00507       /* Set output name */
00508       i++;
00509       if(i == argc) {
00510         printf("Option useage is -o <output template>\n");
00511         return(1);
00512       }
00513       strncpy(output_template, argv[i], MAX_NAME_LEN-1);
00514       output_template[MAX_NAME_LEN-1] = 0;
00515     }else if(strncasecmp(argv[i], "-p", 2) == 0) {
00516       /* Set processing script */
00517       i++;
00518       if(i == argc) {
00519         printf("Option useage is -p <processing script>\n");
00520         return(1);
00521       }
00522       script = argv[i];
00523     }
00524   }
00525 
00526   /******** CHECK EXTENSION OF INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES ********/
00527 
00528   if((input_format = check_format(input_template)) == FORMAT_UNKNOWN) {
00529     printf("Error: Unrecognised input format\n");
00530     return(1);
00531   }
00532   if((output_format = check_format(output_template)) == FORMAT_UNKNOWN) {
00533     printf("Error: Unrecognised output format\n");
00534     return(1);
00535   }
00536   
00537   /************ READ PROCESSING SCRIPT ************/
00538   
00539   if(process_script(argv[0], script)) {
00540     /* Some error compiling script */
00541     return(1);
00542   }
00543 
00544   /******** PRINT INTRO PUFF *********/
00545 
00546   printf("\n   Spice-Weasel photron video enhancement\n");
00547   printf("Knocking MAST videos up a notch since april 2006\n");
00548   printf("      Developed by B.Dudson and A.Meakins\n\n");
00549 
00550   /******** INITIALIZE FRAME BUFFER **********/
00551 
00552   /* Initialize processing variables */
00553   read_init(); /* Note: read MUST init before write */
00554   process_init();
00555   write_init();
00556 
00557   printf("Initializing frame buffer...");
00558   fflush(stdout);
00559   framebuffer = (TFrame**) malloc(sizeof(TFrame*)*nframes);
00560   
00561   for(i=0;i!=nframes;i++) {
00562     framebuffer[i] = (TFrame*) malloc(sizeof(TFrame));
00563     framebuffer[i]->allocated = 0;
00564     framebuffer[i]->last = 0;
00565     if(read_frame(startframe, framebuffer[i])) {
00566       printf("\n***Error reading input frame %d\n", startframe);
00567       exit(1);
00568     }
00569     startframe++;
00570   }
00571   centreframe = (nframes-1)/2; /* The frame in the middle of the buffer */
00572   framereplace = 0;
00573 
00574   input_frame[0]  = (TFrame*) malloc(sizeof(TFrame));   input_frame[0]->allocated  = 0;
00575   input_frame[1]  = (TFrame*) malloc(sizeof(TFrame));   input_frame[1]->allocated  = 0;
00576   output_frame[0] = (TFrame*) malloc(sizeof(TFrame));   output_frame[0]->allocated = 0;
00577   output_frame[1] = (TFrame*) malloc(sizeof(TFrame));   output_frame[1]->allocated = 0;
00578 
00579   input_frame[0]->last = 0;
00580   input_frame[1]->last = 0;
00581   output_frame[0]->last = 0;
00582   output_frame[1]->last = 0;
00583 
00584   frame_read = startframe-1;
00585   frame_written = 0;
00586 
00587   total = (float) (endframe - startframe + 2);
00588   progress = 0.0;
00589  
00590   printf("done\n");
00591 
00592   /******** INITIALIZE SYNC VARIABLES **********/
00593 
00594   pthread_mutex_init(&input_ready_mutex, NULL);
00595   pthread_mutex_init(&output_ready_mutex, NULL);
00596   pthread_mutex_init(&process_ready_mutex, NULL);
00597   pthread_cond_init(&input_ready_cond, NULL);
00598   pthread_cond_init(&output_ready_cond, NULL);
00599   pthread_cond_init(&process_ready_cond, NULL);
00600 
00601   input_ready = 0;
00602   output_ready = 0;
00603   process_ready = 1;
00604   
00605   cycle = 0;
00606   finished = 0;
00607   status = -1;
00608 
00609   /********* CREATE I/O THREADS *********/
00610   if(startframe <= endframe) { /* Check there are more frames to read */
00611 
00612     printf("Starting input thread...");
00613     fflush(stdout);
00614     if(pthread_create(&input_thread, NULL, input_routine, NULL)) {
00615       printf("Failed\n");
00616       return(1);
00617     }
00618     
00619     printf("done\n");
00620     
00621   }else {
00622     /* Exit after one frame */
00623     output_frame[cycle]->last = 1;
00624     finished = 1;
00625   }
00626   
00627   printf("Starting output thread...");
00628   fflush(stdout);
00629   if(pthread_create(&output_thread, NULL, output_routine, NULL)) {
00630     printf("Failed\n");
00631     return(1);
00632   }    
00633   printf("done\n");
00634 
00635   /*********** START PROCESSING LOOP *********/
00636 
00637   printf("========= PROCESSING FRAMES ===========\n");
00638 
00639   do {
00640 
00641     /* Check input and output processes are ready */
00642 
00643     if(finished != 1) {  /* If 1, input thread doesn't exist */
00644       pthread_mutex_lock(&input_ready_mutex);
00645       while(input_ready == cycle) {
00646         pthread_cond_wait(&input_ready_cond, &input_ready_mutex);
00647       }
00648       input_ready = cycle ^ 1;
00649       pthread_mutex_unlock(&input_ready_mutex);
00650     }
00651     pthread_mutex_lock(&output_ready_mutex);
00652     while(output_ready == cycle) {
00653       pthread_cond_wait(&output_ready_cond, &output_ready_mutex);
00654     }
00655     output_ready = cycle ^ 1;
00656     pthread_mutex_unlock(&output_ready_mutex);
00657     
00658     last_read = frame_read;
00659     last_written = frame_written;
00660 
00661     pthread_mutex_lock(&process_ready_mutex);
00662     process_ready = cycle;
00663     pthread_cond_broadcast(&process_ready_cond);
00664     pthread_mutex_unlock(&process_ready_mutex);
00665     
00666     printf("\r Input %5d Output %5d Progress %2.f%%", 
00667            last_read, last_written, progress / total);
00668     fflush(stdout);
00669     progress += 100.0;
00670 
00671     if(status == -1) {
00672       /* This just skips reading first time around - all data in buffer */
00673       status = 0;
00674     }else {
00675       
00676       /* Check if this is the last frame */
00677       if(input_frame[cycle]->last == 1) {
00678         //printf("Processing reached last frame: %d\n", input_frame[cycle]->number);
00679         output_frame[cycle]->last = 1;
00680         finished = 1;
00681       }
00682 
00683       /********** SWAP FRAME BUFFERS ********/
00684       tmpframe = framebuffer[framereplace];
00685       framebuffer[framereplace] = input_frame[cycle];
00686       input_frame[cycle] = tmpframe;
00687     
00688       /* Circular buffer - update indices to the frame to be replaced next
00689          and the frame to be processed */
00690       framereplace++;
00691       centreframe++;
00692       if(framereplace == nframes)
00693         framereplace = 0;
00694       if(centreframe == nframes)
00695         centreframe = 0;
00696     }
00697 
00698     /************* PROCESS DATA ****************
00699      * output frame into output_frame[cycle]   */
00700 
00701     process_frames(framebuffer, nframes, centreframe, output_frame[cycle]);
00702 
00703     /******************************************/
00704 
00705     cycle ^= 1; /* Flip between 0 and 1 */
00706   }while(finished != 1);
00707 
00708   /********** WAIT FOR OUTPUT TO FINISH ***********/
00709 
00710   //printf("Processing finished, waiting for output to finish\n");
00711   pthread_mutex_lock(&output_ready_mutex);
00712   while(output_ready == cycle) {
00713     pthread_cond_wait(&output_ready_cond, &output_ready_mutex);
00714   }
00715   pthread_mutex_unlock(&output_ready_mutex);
00716 
00717   pthread_mutex_lock(&process_ready_mutex);
00718   process_ready = cycle;
00719   pthread_cond_broadcast(&process_ready_cond);
00720   pthread_mutex_unlock(&process_ready_mutex);
00721 
00722   /* Wait for i/o to finish */
00723   pthread_join(output_thread, &retval);
00724 
00725   /* Clean up */
00726   read_finish();
00727   write_finish();
00728 
00729   end_time = time(NULL);
00730 
00731   printf("\nGot %d blasts from the spice-weasel in %d seconds. Bam!!!\n",
00732          endframe - startframe + 2, (int) (end_time - start_time));
00733   return(0);
00734 }
00735 
00736
Generated on Mon Oct 9 17:56:27 2006 for spiceweasel by  1.4.7
